intro: Geissaspis cristata var. cristata, commonly known as the crested geissaspis, is a rare and unique plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, branched inflorescence that resembles a crown, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in arid or semi-arid environments. It has small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
